spx.utils

Class Visuals

  • java.lang.Object
    • spx.utils.Visuals

  • public class Visuals
extends java.lang.Object
    The Visuals class provides convenience functions for dealing with GraphicsConfiguration, which represent X11 Visuals under Linux.

    The getGC method is useful when a Java application must be constructed with X11 Visuals of a specified depth.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.awt.GraphicsConfiguration getGC(int screenNum, int depth)
      Gets a GraphicsConfiguration for the specified screen with the required depth.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getGC

        public static java.awt.GraphicsConfiguration getGC(int screenNum,
                                                   int depth)
        Gets a GraphicsConfiguration for the specified screen with the required depth.

        This method will normally be called from the main method of a Java application so that the resulting GraphicsConfiguration object can be passed to the constructor of the main JFrame or other container.

        Parameters:
        screenNum - Screen number.
        depth - Required GC depth.
        Returns:
        GraphicsConfiguration or null on error.
